> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
> wrote:
>  > webbernet_1 wrote:
>  >
>  > > Hi,
>  > >
>  > > Im trying to compile and test an example of xmlunit
>  > > (http://xmlunit.sourceforge.net/example.html) but doenst work.
>  > > Someone know how? We should call junit, right? Have you same

> successfully,

> 
> 
> Hi,
> 
> Well i dont know if its my ant build file. I dont know exactly how to
> call xmlunit. I think thats the point.
> 
> When i call junit the output is:
> 
> Testsuite: MyXMLTestCase
> Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 0 sec
> 
>       Caused an ERROR
> MyXMLTestCase
> java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: MyXMLTestCase
>       at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:198)
>       at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
>       at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:186)
>       at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306)
>       at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass
> (Launcher.java:265)
>       at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:262)
>       at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:262)

Pedro, this is not a problem with XMLUnit. It is a problem with the way 
you are using JUnit.

You must put your test case class (MyXMLTestCase) into the CLASSPATH of 
the <junit> (or <java>) task you use to execute your tests.

Please consult the JUnit FAQ (Google "JUnit FAQ") if you need more details.

Good luck.

One more thing: when you post messages they are moderated, so do not 
post the same message many times. Someone has to approve them before you 
see them on the list. Thank you.
--
